engineers.name: Jean D.
engineers.title: Backend Engineer
engineers.bio: Versatile backend engineer with 10+ years of hands-on experience in Java, cloud platforms (GCP, AWS), and large-scale system design. Proven track record delivering secure, scalable software for government and enterprise clients. Skilled in Spring Boot, REST APIs, CI/CD pipelines, and backend automation. On the side, actively building GenAI tools using OpenAI APIs and prompt engineering, bringing a future-focused mindset to modern software teams.

projects.name: GenAI Chatbot Backend
projects.description: Built a Java-based chatbot using Spring Boot that connects to OpenAI’s GPT API. The backend supports multi-input handling, dynamic response generation, and extensible endpoints for real-world use cases like service suggestions and quote generation. Designed with modularity and scalability in mind, the system can integrate logic for service upsells, user profiling, and media uploads.

engineers.name: Sai Bharath P.
engineers.title: AI/ML Engineer
engineers.bio: AI/ML Engineer with 3+ years of experience building production-ready AI systems in credit risk modeling, computer vision, generative AI, and recommendation engines. Proven track record of deploying scalable machine learning pipelines and optimizing large language models (LLMs) across AWS, GCP, and Azure. Adept in Python, PyTorch, Kubernetes, and MLOps, with a Master’s in Computer Science from SUNY Buffalo. Passionate about innovation at the intersection of deep learning, NLP, and distributed systems.

projects.name: Smart Traffic Management System
projects.description: Designed and deployed an AI-based system using reinforcement learning and computer vision to optimize real-time traffic light control. Integrated IoT sensors and cameras to monitor vehicle and pedestrian flow, enabling dynamic signal adjustment. Deployed the system in a simulated urban environment, achieving a 40% reduction in traffic congestion and 25% decrease in commute time for over 50,000 commuters.

projects.name: AI-Driven Personal Finance Assistant
projects.description: Built a voice- and text-based AI assistant that helps users manage budgets, categorize transactions, and get tailored financial advice. Used NLP techniques to parse natural language queries and provide personalized recommendations, boosting user engagement by 40% and increasing savings by an average of 15%.

engineers.name: Smit U.
engineers.title: Software Engineer
engineers.bio: I’m a Computer Science graduate student at the University at Buffalo (graduating Dec 2025), with 2.5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer at o9 Solutions. My expertise spans full-stack development, scalable cloud-native applications, and real-time data systems using React, Node.js, Python, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes. I’ve led and contributed to features impacting over 200K daily users, optimized data pipelines handling 1M+ transactions/day, and built microservices with CI/CD and serverless architectures. I’m also passionate about machine learning, with hands-on project experience in real-time defect detection and AI-driven platforms. Ranked in the top 20% globally on LeetCode, I bring strong problem-solving skills and a continuous improvement mindset to every team I join.

projects.name: Career Connect Platform
projects.description: Built a full-stack job portal enabling users to search, apply, and manage job postings. Implemented RESTful APIs using Spring Boot and Node.js, connected to a MySQL database, and deployed the platform using Kubernetes for seamless scaling and CI/CD.

projects.name: Multilingual Therapy Application
projects.description: Built a real-time voice therapy app supporting 20+ languages with accessibility-first UI. WebSocket used for low-latency voice transmission. Data stored in MongoDB. Optimized for concurrent use and inclusivity.

engineers.name: David P.
engineers.title: Senior Computer Science Student
engineers.bio: Hey there! I'm David Pang, a senior Computer Science student at the University at Buffalo, graduating in 2025. I'm interested in systems integration and architecture—designing and implementing scalable, efficient solutions that solve real problems that align with business solutions. I enjoy working across layers to build systems that are maintainable and available. My experience spans multiple languages and developmental tools, and I'm driven by the challenge of engineering software that stays available under scaling pressure, and is reasonably updatable for future individuals. I'm currently looking into cloud computing resources such as AWS and studying for systems and software design.

projects.name: Student Meal Delivery Platform
projects.description: Built a delivery web application similar to DoorDash, featuring real-time location tracking, payment processing, and dynamic business filtering based on geolocation. Collaborated in an Agile team using Scrum for efficient project delivery.

projects.name: Lee’s Market
projects.description: Developed a full-stack web application for a local business that sells products to consumers and restaurants in bulk, including a responsive UI, secure user authentication, and a containerized backend. Designed RESTful APIs and implemented XSRF protection, with deployment-ready architecture using Docker and nginx.

Currently pursuing a STEM master’s degree in Management Information Systems, with a focus on building scalable, insight-driven solutions that bridge data and business.

projects.name: PolicyGuard AI – Generative Agent for Privacy Regulation Compliance
projects.description: Developed an LLM-powered assistant using RAG, LangChain, and OpenAI to parse and query GDPR/CCPA policies. Reduced legal review time by 50% and laid groundwork for responsible GenAI in compliance.

projects.name: Journal Entry Classification & Variance Detection Automation
